intro: Epidendrum tacarcunense, commonly known as the Tacarcuña orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the Andean regions of South America. It features a pseudobulbous stem with fleshy leaves that are typically dark green and somewhat hairy. The plant produces racemes of fragrant, showy flowers in shades of white, yellow, and pink, often with a contrasting lip. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
